meanings.definition: To twist or turn in a sinuous or circular course.
meanings.sent1: She wili the ribbon around the gift.
meanings.sent2: The river wili through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to wili its way out of the tangled yarn.
meanings.sent4: His words wili around my mind, leaving me confused.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's body seemed to wili effortlessly on stage.

meanings.sent1: The snake's wili was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's routine included a graceful wili.
meanings.sent3: The wili of the tornado caused destruction in its path.
meanings.sent4: The wili of the plot kept me on the edge of my seat.
meanings.sent5: The wili of the rollercoaster made my stomach drop.
